member.name: T:ExpTreeLib.CProcDataObject
member.Summary: This class takes the IDataObject or .Net DataObjectpassed into DragEnter and builds a IDataObject that is suitable for use when interacting with the IDropTarget of a Folder. Requirements: The input IDataObject must contain at least one of the following Formats and Data 1. An ArrayList of CShItems 2. A Shell IDList Array 3. A FileDrop structure A Valid instance of this class will have and expose 1. Dobj -- A COM IDataObject suitable for use in interaction with a Folder's IDropTarget Dobj will have, at least, a valid Shell IDList Array representing the Dragged Items 2. DragData -- An ArrayList of 1 or more CShItems representing the Dragged Items Processing Steps: 1. Check for presence of one or more of the required Formats with valid Data 2. Build or use the provided ArrayList of CShItems 3. Ensure that all items are of same FileSystem/Non-FileSystem classification 4. Build or use the provided Shell IDList Array (Note that we don't necessarily build the FileDrop structure) 5. if classification is FileSystem 5a. Store Shell IDList Array into DataObject, if not already there 5b. Obtain COM IDataObject 6, Else for non-FileSystem classification 6a. Obtain the IDataObject of the Virtual Folder (A COM object) 6b. Store Shell IDList Array into that Object 7. If no errors to this point, set m_IsValid to True 8. Done The class also contains a number of useful shared methods for dealing with IDataObject

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CProcDataObject.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.DataObject@)
member.Summary: Constructor starting with a .Net Data object .Net DataObjects are easy to work with, but are useless if the Dragged items are non-FileSystem The DragWrapper class will never call this. It is here for playing around with the CDragWrapper class

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CProcDataObject.#ctor(System.IntPtr@)
member.Summary: This constructor takes a pointer to an IDataObject obtained from a IDropTarget Interface's DragEnter method. If the pointer points to a .Net DataObject (which only happens within the same app), convert it and call ProcessNetDataObject Otherwise, it from another app, possibly Win Explorer, so check it for the required formats and build m_DragList. Any error just quits, leaving m_IsValid as False ... Caller must check

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CProcDataObject.ProcessCOMIDataObject(ExpTreeLib.ShellDll.IDataObject)
member.Summary: Given an IDataObject from some non-net source, Build the m_DragList ArrayList. Also ensure that the IDataObject has "Shell IDList Array" formatted data If not, build it in m_StreamCIDA, if so, copy to m_StreamCIDA If dealing with all FileSystem Items,

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CProcDataObject.MakeShellIDArray(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.Summary: Shell Folders prefer their IDragData to contain this format which is NOT directly supported by .Net. The underlying structure is the CIDA structure which is basically VB and VB.Net Hostile. If "Make ShortCut(s) here" is the desired or POSSIBLE effect of the drag, then this format is REQUIRED -- otherwise the Folder will interpret the DragDropEffects.Link to be "Create Document Shortcut" which is NEVER the desired effect in this case The normal CIDA contains the Absolute PIDL of the source Folder and Relative PIDLs for each Item in the Drag. I cheat a bit an provide the Absolute PIDL of the Desktop (00, a short) and the Absolute PIDLs for the Items (all such Absolute PIDLS ar relative to the Desktop.
member.Credit: http://www.dotnetmonster.com/Uwe/Forum.aspx/dotnet-interop/3482/Drag-and-Drop The overall concept and much code taken from the above reference Dave Anderson's response, translated from C# to VB.Net, was the basis of this routine An AHA momemnt and a ref to the above url came from http://www.Planet-Source-Code.com/vb/scripts/ShowCode.asp?txtCodeId=61324%26lngWId=1

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CProcDataObject.MakeStreamFromCIDA(System.IntPtr)
member.Summary: Given an IntPtr pointing to a CIDA, copy the CIDA to a new MemoryStream

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CProcDataObject.MakeDragListFromCIDA
member.Summary: Builds m_DragList from m_StreamCIDA

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.Summary: Given a Byte() containing the Pidl of the parent folder and another Byte() containing the Pidl of the Item, relative to the Folder, Create a CShItem for the Item. This is of primary use in dealing with "Shell IDList Array" formatted info passed in a Drag Operation

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.IsValidPidl(System.Byte[])
member.Summary: It is impossible to validate a PIDL completely since its contents are arbitrarily defined by the creating Shell Namespace. However, it is possible to validate the structure of a PIDL.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.GetParentOf(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@)
member.Summary: Returns both the IShellFolder interface of the parent folder and the relative pidl of the input PIDL
member.remarks: Several internal functions need this information and do not have it readily available. GetParentOf serves those functions

Relative Pidl of this Item.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.SetDispType
member.summary: Set DisplayName, TypeName, and SortFlag when actually needed

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.FillDemandInfo
member.summary: Obtains information available from FileInfo.

member.name: P:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.IsReadOnly
member.Summary: The IsReadOnly attribute causes an annoying access to any floppy drives on the system. To postpone this (or avoid, depending on user action), the attribute is only queried when asked for

member.name: P:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.IsSystem
member.Summary: The IsSystem attribute is seldom used, but required by DragDrop operations. Since there is no way of getting ONLY the System attribute without getting the RO attribute (which forces a reference to the floppy drive), we pay the price of getting its own File/DirectoryInfo for this purpose alone.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.GetDeskTop
member.summary: If not initialized, then build DesktopBase once done, or if initialized already,
member.returns: The DesktopBase CShItem representing the desktop

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.IsAncestorOf(ExpTreeLib.CShItem,ExpTreeLib.CShItem,System.Boolean)
member.Summary: IsAncestorOf returns True if CShItem ancestor is an ancestor of CShItem current if OS is Win2K or above, uses the ILIsParent API, otherwise uses the cPidl function StartsWith. This is necessary since ILIsParent in only available in Win2K or above systems AND StartsWith fails on some folders on XP systems (most obviously some Network Folder Shortcuts, but also Control Panel. Note, StartsWith always works on systems prior to XP. NOTE: if ancestor and current reference the same Item, both methods return True

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.IsAncestorOf(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.Summary: Compares a candidate Ancestor PIDL with a Child PIDL and returns True if Ancestor is an ancestor of the child. if fParent is True, then only return True if Ancestor is the immediate parent of the Child

member.name: T:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.WalkAllCallBack
member.Summary: The WalkAllCallBack delegate defines the signature of the routine to be passed to DirWalker Usage: dim d1 as new CshItem.WalkAllCallBack(addressof yourroutine) Callback function receives a CShItem for each file and Directory in Starting Directory and each sub-directory of this directory and each sub-dir of each sub-dir ....

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.AllFolderWalk(ExpTreeLib.CShItem,ExpTreeLib.CShItem.WalkAllCallBack,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.Summary: AllFolderWalk recursively walks down directories from cStart, calling its callback routine, WalkAllCallBack, for each Directory and File encountered, including those in cStart. UserLevel is incremented by 1 for each level of dirs that DirWalker recurses thru. Tag in an Integer that is simply passed, unmodified to the callback, with each CShItem encountered, both File and Directory CShItems.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.GetDirectories(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the Directories of this sub-folder as an ArrayList of CShitems
member.param: Optional, default=True, Refresh the directories
member.returns: An ArrayList of CShItems. May return an empty ArrayList if there are none.
member.remarks: revised to alway return an up-to-date list unless specifically instructed not to (useful in constructs like: if CSI.RefreshDirectories then Dirs = CSI.GetDirectories(False) ' just did a Refresh

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.GetFiles
member.summary: Returns the Files of this sub-folder as an ArrayList of CShitems Note: we do not keep the arraylist of files, Generate it each time
member.returns: An ArrayList of CShItems. May return an empty ArrayList if there are none.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.GetFiles(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the Files of this sub-folder, filtered by a filtering string, as an ArrayList of CShitems Note: we do not keep the arraylist of files, Generate it each time
member.param: A filter string (for example: *.Doc)
member.returns: An ArrayList of CShItems. May return an empty ArrayList if there are none.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.GetItems
member.summary: Returns the Directories and Files of this sub-folder as an ArrayList of CShitems Note: we do not keep the arraylist of files, Generate it each time
member.returns: An ArrayList of CShItems. May return an empty ArrayList if there are none.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.GetFileName
member.Summary: GetFileName returns the Full file name of this item. Specifically, for a link file (xxx.txt.lnk for example) the DisplayName property will return xxx.txt, this method will return xxx.txt.lnk. In most cases this is equivalent of System.IO.Path.GetFileName(m_Path). However, some m_Paths actually are GUIDs. In that case, this routine returns the DisplayName

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.RefreshDirectories
member.Summary: A lower cost way of Refreshing the Directories of this CShItem
member.returns: Returns True if there were any changes

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.ToString
member.summary: Returns the DisplayName as the normal ToString value

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.DebugDump
member.summary: Summary of DebugDump.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.GetContents(ExpTreeLib.ShellDll.SHCONTF,System.Boolean)
member.Summary: Returns the requested Items of this Folder as an ArrayList of CShitems unless the IntPtrOnly flag is set. If IntPtrOnly is True, return an ArrayList of PIDLs.
member.param: A set of one or more SHCONTF flags indicating which items to return
True to suppress generation of CShItems, returning only an ArrayList of IntPtrs to RELATIVE PIDLs for the contents of this Folder

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.ItemIDSize(System.IntPtr)
member.Summary: Get Size in bytes of the first (possibly only) SHItem in an ID list. Note: the full size of the item is the sum of the sizes of all SHItems in the list!!

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.ItemIDListSize(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: computes the actual size of the ItemIDList pointed to by pidl
member.param: The pidl pointing to an ItemIDList
member.returns: Returns actual size of the ItemIDList, less the terminating nulnul

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.PidlCount(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Counts the total number of SHItems in input pidl
member.param: The pidl to obtain the count for
member.returns: Returns the count of SHItems pointed to by pidl

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.GetLastID(System.IntPtr)
member.Summary: GetLastId -- returns a pointer to the last ITEMID in a valid ITEMIDLIST. Returned pointer SHOULD NOT be released since it points to place within the original PIDL
member.returns: IntPtr pointing to last ITEMID in ITEMIDLIST structure, Returns IntPtr.Zero if given a null pointer. If given a pointer to the Desktop, will return same pointer.
member.remarks: This is what the API ILFindLastID does, however IL... functions are not supported before Win2K.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.concatPidls(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Concatenates the contents of two pidls into a new Pidl (ended by 00) allocating CoTaskMem to hold the result, placing the concatenation (followed by 00) into the allocated Memory, and returning an IntPtr pointing to the allocated mem
member.param: IntPtr to a well formed SHItemIDList or IntPtr.Zero
IntPtr to a well formed SHItemIDList or IntPtr.Zero
member.returns: Returns a ptr to an ItemIDList containing the concatenation of the two (followed by the req 2 zeros Caller must Free this pidl when done with it

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.TrimPidl(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Returns an ItemIDList with the last ItemID trimed off This is necessary since I cannot get SHBindToParent to work It's purpose is to generate an ItemIDList for the Parent of a Special Folder which can then be processed with DesktopBase.BindToObject, yeilding a Folder for the parent of the Special Folder It also creates and passes back a RELATIVE pidl for this item
member.param: A pointer to a well formed ItemIDList. The PIDL to trim
BYREF IntPtr which will point to a new relative pidl containing the contents of the last ItemID in the ItemIDList terminated by the required 2 nulls.
member.returns: an ItemIDList with the last element removed. Caller must Free this item when through with it Also returns the new relative pidl in the 2nd parameter Caller must Free this pidl as well, when through with it

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.DumpPidl(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Dumps, to the Debug output, the contents of the mem block pointed to by a PIDL. Depends on the internal structure of a PIDL
member.param: The IntPtr(a PIDL) pointing to the block to dump

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.DumpHex(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.Summary: Dump a portion or all of a Byte Array to Debug output
member.param: A single dimension Byte Array
Optional start index of area to dump (default = 0)
Optional last index position to dump (default = end of array)

member.name: T:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.TagComparer
member.Summary: It is sometimes useful to sort a list of TreeNodes, ListViewItems, or other objects in an order based on CShItems in their Tag use this Icomparer for that Sort

member.name: T:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl
member.Summary: cPidl class contains a Byte() representation of a PIDL and certain Methods and Properties for comparing one cPidl to another

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl.ToPIDL
member.Summary: Copy the contents of a byte() containing a pidl to CoTaskMemory, returning an IntPtr that points to that mem block Assumes that this cPidl is properly terminated, as all New cPidls are. Caller must Free the returned IntPtr when done with mem block.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl.Decompose
member.Summary: Returns an object containing a byte() for each of this cPidl's ITEMIDs (individual PIDLS), in order such that obj(0) is a byte() containing the bytes of the first ITEMID, etc. Each ITEMID is properly terminated with a nulnul

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl.IsEqual(ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl)
member.Summary: Returns True if input cPidl's content exactly match the contents of this instance

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl.JoinPidlBytes(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.Summary: Join two byte arrays containing PIDLS, returning a Byte() containing the resultant ITEMIDLIST. Both Byte() must be properly terminated (nulnul) Returns NOTHING if error

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl.BytesToPidl(System.Byte[])
member.Summary: Copy the contents of a byte() containing a pidl to CoTaskMemory, returning an IntPtr that points to that mem block Caller must free the IntPtr when done with it

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl.StartsWith(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.Summary: returns True if the beginning of pidlA matches PidlB exactly for pidlB's entire length

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl.StartsWith(ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl,ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl)
member.Summary: returns True if the beginning of A matches B exactly for B's entire length

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl.StartsWith(ExpTreeLib.CShItem.cPidl)
member.Summary: Returns true if the CPidl input parameter exactly matches the beginning of this instance of CPidl

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.ExpTree.RefreshTree(ExpTreeLib.CShItem)
member.Summary: RefreshTree Method thanks to Calum McLellan

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.ExpTree.tv1_VisibleChanged(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.Summary: When a form containing this control is Hidden and then re-Shown, the association to the SystemImageList is lost. Also lost is the Expanded state of the various TreeNodes. The VisibleChanged Event occurs when the form is re-shown (and other times as well). We re-establish the SystemImageList as the ImageList for the TreeView and restore at least some of the Expansion.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.ExpTree.tv1_BeforeCollapse(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewCancelEventArgs)
member.Summary: Should never occur since if the condition tested for is True, the user should never be able to Collapse the node. However, it is theoretically possible for the code to request a collapse of this node If it occurs, cancel it

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.ExpTree.FindAncestorNode(ExpTreeLib.CShItem)
member.Summary: Given a CShItem, find the TreeNode that belongs to the equivalent (matching PIDL) CShItem's most immediate surviving ancestor. Note: referential comparison might not work since there is no guarantee that the exact same CShItem is stored in the tree.
member.returns: Me.Root if not found, otherwise the Treenode whose .Tag is equivalent to the input CShItem's most immediate surviving ancestor

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.ExpTree.DragWrapper_ShDragEnter(System.Collections.ArrayList,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.Summary: ShDragEnter does nothing. It is here for debug tracking

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.ExpTree.DragWrapper_ShDragLeave
member.Summary: Drag has left the control. Cleanup what we have to

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.ExpTree.DragWrapper_ShDragOver(System.Object,System.Drawing.Point,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.Summary: ShDragOver manages the appearance of the TreeView. Management of the underlying FolderItem is done in DragWrapper Credit to Cory Smith for TreeView colorizing technique and code, at http://addressof.com/blog/archive/2004/10/01/955.aspx Node expansion based on expandNodeTimer added by me.

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.ShellDll.SHGetNewLinkInfo(System.String@,System.String@,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Boolean@,ExpTreeLib.ShellDll.SHGNLI)
member.Summary: Despite its name, the API returns a filename for a link to be copied/created in a Target directory, with a specific LinkTarget. It will create a unique name unless instructed otherwise (SHGLNI_NOUNIQUE). And add the ".lnk" extension, unless instructed otherwise(SHGLNI.NOLNK)

member.name: M:ExpTreeLib.ShellDll.SHGetNewLinkInfo(System.IntPtr,System.String@,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Boolean@,ExpTreeLib.ShellDll.SHGNLI)
member.Summary: Same function using a PIDL as the pszLinkTo. SHGNLI.PIDL must be set.
